definition: to plagiarize/to copy/to attack the flank or rear of an enemy
to make a copy/to plagiarize/to search and seize/to raid/to grab/to go off with/to take a shortcut/to make a turning move/to fold one's arms
to attack/to inherit/classifier for suits (esp. of funeral robes)

sentences.english: Several methods are taken in US universities to stop students' plagiarizing on line.
sentences.chinese: 美国大学采取好几种方法来阻止学生在网络上面抄袭。

sentences.english: The poem employs as its first lines a verse plagiarized from a billboard .
sentences.chinese: 这首诗开头的几行抄袭了一个广告牌上的一节诗。

sentences.english: The case was about a screenwriter plagiarizing another writer's novel.
sentences.chinese: 此案是关于一位编剧抄袭另一个作家的小说。

sentences.english: just making sure that things are not plagiarized.
sentences.chinese: 只是为了确保没有抄袭。

sentences.english: Recent studies have shown that a growing number of college students in China plagiarize.
sentences.chinese: 最近的研究表明，许多中国学生抄袭。

sentences.english: Furthermore, rich of information easily abets vogue of copy.
sentences.chinese: 而且，信息富足容易助长抄袭之风。

sentences.english: Well, let's see. We'll do some jumping, I guess.
sentences.chinese: 懒惰的抄袭者好的，我们来看一下。

sentences.english: Do people in your school take plagiarism seriously?
sentences.chinese: 你们学校的人对抄袭的态度严肃吗？

sentences.english: The teacher made an example of the boy who copied from another student during a test.
sentences.chinese: 老师公开处罚那个考试抄袭他人的学生以示儆戒。

sentences.english: Rip off as many samples from horror movies as possible to use in your extreme album. Copyright is for pussies .
sentences.chinese: 从恐怖电影中抄袭尽量多的片断用在你的极端专辑中。

sentences.english: The lazy student cribbed the composition off me.
sentences.chinese: 那个懒惰的学生抄袭了我的作文。

sentences.english: He cribbed the plot of his narrative from another author.
sentences.chinese: 他从别的作者那里抄袭了他这段描述。

sentences.english: Soon after, Guo was accused of plagiarizing the novel from Zhuang Yu’s “In and Out of the Circle.”
sentences.chinese: 随后，郭敬明被指控抄袭庄羽的《圈里圈外》。

sentences.english: Plagiarism is a great enemy of scientific research that deserves nothing but detestation.
sentences.chinese: 抄袭乃科学研究之大敌，为人不齿。

sentences.english: Do you feel people are taking the idea of self-ownership seriously?
sentences.chinese: 你觉得抄袭别人的风格是严重的问题吗？

sentences.english: The student will plagiarize the work to give his study to bring the adverse consequences.
sentences.chinese: 学生抄袭作业会给他的学习带来很多不良后果。

definition: to embezzle/to defraud/to use illegitimately/to misappropriate
to use an image without permission
to modify a text so it can be plagiarized without detection (neologism c. 2014, formed by analogy with 洗錢|洗钱[xi3 qian2], to launder money)
(neologism c. 2018) to incorporate ideas or material from sb else's creative work in one's own work
the attitude of mechanically borrowing (ideas etc)
to infringe the rights of/to violate/infringement
to pick up what others say (idiom); to pass off other people's opinions as one's own/to parrot
to forward (a shipment)/to reprint sth published elsewhere/Taiwan pr. [zhuan3 zai4]
to stir-fry leftover rice/fig. to rehash the same story/to serve up the same old product
